intro: Schrebera mazoensis, commonly known as the Mexican Schrebera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Schrebera mazoensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
